section.para: The ngx_http_v3_module module (1.23.4) provides experimental support for HTTP/3.

This module is not built by default, it should be enabled with the --with-http_v3_module configuration parameter.
An SSL library that provides QUIC support such as BoringSSL, LibreSSL, or QuicTLS is recommended to build and run this module. Otherwise, when using the OpenSSL library, OpenSSL compatibility layer will be used that does not support early data.

para.note: The module is available as nginx-quic in prebult Linux packages. The module is also available as part of our commercial subscription in a separate nginx-plus-http3 package.

section.name: Known Issues
section.para: The module is experimental, caveat emptor applies.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: http3_hq
directive.para: Enables HTTP/0.9 protocol negotiation used in QUIC interoperability tests.

directive.name: http3_max_concurrent_pushes
directive.para: Limits the maximum number of concurrent push requests in a connection.

directive.name: http3_max_concurrent_streams
directive.para: Sets the maximum number of concurrent HTTP/3 request streams in a connection.

directive.name: http3_push
directive.para: Several http3_push directives can be specified on the same configuration level. The off parameter cancels the effect of the http3_push directives inherited from the previous configuration level.

directive.name: http3_push_preload
directive.para: Enables automatic conversion of preload links specified in the Link response header fields into push requests.

directive.name: http3_stream_buffer_size
directive.para: Sets the size of the buffer used for reading and writing of the QUIC streams.

directive.name: quic_active_connection_id_limit
directive.para: Sets the QUIC active_connection_id_limit transport parameter value. This is the maximum number of client connection IDs which can be stored on the server.

directive.name: quic_bpf
directive.para: Enables routing of QUIC packets using eBPF. When enabled, this allows supporting QUIC connection migration.

para.note: The directive is only supported on Linux 5.7+.

directive.name: quic_gso
directive.para: Enables sending in optimized batch mode using segmentation offloading.

para.note: Optimized sending is supported only on Linux featuring UDP_SEGMENT.

directive.name: quic_host_key
directive.para: Sets a file with the secret key used to encrypt stateless reset and address validation tokens. By default, a random key is generated on each reload. Tokens generated with old keys are not accepted.

directive.name: quic_mtu
directive.para: Sets the QUIC max_udp_payload_size transport parameter value. This is the maximum UDP payload possible to receive.

directive.name: quic_retry
directive.para: Enables the QUIC Address Validation feature. This includes sending a new token in a Retry packet or a NEW_TOKEN frame and validating a token received in the Initial packet.

section.name: Embedded Variables
section.para:
The ngx_http_v3_module module supports the following embedded variables:
$http3
negotiated protocol identifier: “h3” for HTTP/3 connections, “hq” for hq connections, or an empty string otherwise.
